intro: Dendrocnide batanensis, commonly known as the Batan stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species known for their stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and small greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The leaves and stems contain irritant chemicals that can cause skin irritation upon contact.
